text: the biggest thing is just addressing
people's fears about this economic

specifically sub Republicans react to
certain parts of the address but don't
don't leave out the rest of the world
because he's going to be talking to them
too there are many iconic presidential
moments and Barack Obama will have
another one on Tuesday with an address
to a joint session of Congress each
president approaches the task
differently we propose a permanent
investment tax credit for the smallest
firms in this country with revenues of
under 5 million dollar bill clinton was
known for going through his entire
agenda in detail while george w bush was
often more thematic i think the
president will will be somewhat of a mix
but i don't think he's going to get
bogged down in you know nitty gritty
Jackie comms covers economic issues a
subject that is expected to dominate mr.
obama's address this is the week where
president obama will try to signal that
the United States is really serious
about taking hold of its long-term
fiscal responsibilities to show that we
really do still care about deficits we
cannot and will not sustain deficits
like these without it contrary to the
prevailing wisdom in Washington these
past few years we cannot simply spend as
we please and defer the consequences to
the next budget the next administration
or the next generation but that isn't
all you know there were a lot of people
that thought when he took office amid a
recession that he was going to have to
put his campaign promise to expand
health care on a shelf and the
administration says the opposite in
addition to health care the
administration is planning to focus
domestically on energy policy and
education it's an audacious agenda we
cannot successfully address any of our
problems without addressing them all and
that is exactly what the strategy we are
pursuing is designed to do but the
biggest challenge isn't whether they'll
work it's whether he can get him past
at some point soon foreign policy always
takes center stage because we can't
control what other countries are doing
Helene Cooper covers the
administration's foreign policy the
biggest move so far is in Afghanistan
where they recently committed an
additional 17 thousand troops to the
conflict Obama was elected on an
anti-war platform and now he has to
convince the American people that
sending more of their troops is in the
interest of American national security
he also though has to make a case to the
Europeans and America's allies in NATO
that day to need to step up to the plate
the entire region presents a series of

and there's no easy answer about how to

don't have the time to wait you sort of
have to go after Ron and go after

Jeff Zeleny covers the White House will
be an extension of two of the biggest

here on in town let's begin working

what this gives President Obama a chance
